entry.title: WINSTON CITY COUNCIL MEETING TUESDAY EVENING
entry.summary: February 17, 2026 3:40 a.m. The Winston City Council will meet on Tuesday night at 7:00 p.m. Agenda items include a resolution to approve an intergovernmental agreement with Douglas County regarding work crews. Councilors will consider appointment and re-appointment requests for a number of committees. Three new business licenses will be voted on. Department reports...

entry.title: MYRTLE CREEK CITY COUNCIL WITH TUESDAY EVENING MEETING
entry.summary: February 17, 2026 3:30 a.m. The Myrtle Creek City Council will hold a meeting Tuesday evening. Councilors will consider entering into an agreement with Dougherty Landscape Architects for the creation of a Millsite Park Master Plan. The company’s bid is for $56,570. The council will vote on declaring a 1994 rescue unit vehicle as surplus....

entry.title: Made for Trades Program Turns Dugout Rebuild Into Hands-On Career Training for Local Youth
entry.summary: A dugout rebuild in Douglas County is doubling as hands-on trade training for local youth. Through the Made for Trades program, students are gaining construction experience, earning scholarships and preparing for careers in skilled trades while helping improve a community ballfield.

entry.title: Police Investigating Robbery at Sutherlin Bar; Suspects Impersonated Officers
entry.summary: Sutherlin police are investigating a Feb. 15 robbery at the Offyce Bar after two masked men posing as officers reportedly took cash and fled south on I-5 in a vehicle. No weapons were shown and no one was hurt. Police ask anyone with information to contact SPD.

entry.summary: February 16, 2026 3:00 p.m. ‘ A H.O.P.E. Drug Court participant has launched “Warming Little Hearts”. entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 02.16.26
entry.summary: Live from Springfield, 4th District Congresswoman Val Hoyle talks about federal funds coming to Douglas County, the upcoming mid-term elections, her legislative priorities for this year, concerns she is hearing from constituents, her reaction to the Epstein files and a number of other topics.

entry.summary: Alicia Brincat said she started making concealed carry bags and purses about 12 years ago because she couldn't find one to her satisfaction.

entry.summary: From creating tea blends, landscaping, plant propagation, grafting apple trees and floral arranging, an upcoming March 7 conference will offer classes for any type of gardener.

entry.title: WASHINGTON’S BIRTHDAY/PRESIDENT’S DAY CLOSURES LISTED
entry.summary: February 16, 2026 4:00 a.m. Monday is Washington’s Birthday, also known as President’s Day and that means there are a number of closures. Federal, state, county and city offices are closed. No regular mail will be delivered. School is not in session. Banks and credit unions will not be open. Many professional offices are closed...

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory, Storm Warning issued for Douglas County as snow levels drop this week
entry.summary: A Winter Weather Advisory and Winter Storm Warning are in effect for central Douglas County from late Monday through Thursday. Valley areas including Roseburg could see light snow, while higher elevations may get heavy accumulations. Travel impacts are likely, especially Tuesday.

entry.title: Investigators allege Roseburg assistants caused student injuries
entry.summary: Two instructional assistants from the Roseburg School District are facing charges after an investigation into injuries sustained by students at Fremont Middle School, according to the Douglas County Sheriff's Office.

entry.title: Ingram Content Group expands Roseburg distribution center with new printing facility
entry.summary: In 1994, physical and digital book distributor Ingram Content Group (ICG) opened its Roseburg distribution center, bringing jobs and industry to residents of Douglas County. This year, the company plans to push that even further.
